title: Conda install conflicts
body:
I am using Mamba to try and install the BioConda packages listed in the Readme.
Unfortunately, I get the following error message:
```
Could not solve for environment specs
The following packages are incompatible
├─ samtools 1.11**  is not installable because it requires
│  └─ htslib >=1.11,<1.20.0a0  but there are no viable options
│     ├─ htslib 1.11 would require
│     │  └─ libdeflate >=1.6,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
│     ├─ htslib [1.11|1.12|1.13|1.14] would require
│     │  └─ libdeflate >=1.7,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
│     ├─ htslib 1.14 would require
│     │  └─ libdeflate >=1.9,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
│     ├─ htslib [1.14|1.15|1.15.1] would require
│     │  └─ libdeflate >=1.10,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
│     ├─ htslib [1.15.1|1.16|1.17] would require
│     │  └─ libdeflate >=1.13,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
│     └─ htslib [1.17|1.18|1.19] would require
│        └─ libdeflate >=1.18,<1.20.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
├─ ucsc-bigwigaverageoverbed 366**  is installable with the potential options
│  ├─ ucsc-bigwigaverageoverbed 366 would require
│  │  └─ openssl >=1.0.2o,<1.0.3a , which can be installed;
│  └─ ucsc-bigwigaverageoverbed 366 would require
│     └─ openssl >=1.0.2p,<1.0.3a , which can be installed;
└─ ucsc-wigtobigwig 357**  is not installable because there are no viable options
   ├─ ucsc-wigtobigwig 357 would require
   │  └─ openssl >=1.1.0,<=1.1.1 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported;
   └─ ucsc-wigtobigwig 357 would require
      └─ mysql-connector-c >=6.1.11,<6.1.12.0a0 , which conflicts with any installable versions previously reported.
```
The Conda environment I'm using is freshly created and blank.
I get no conflict by removing versions from the install command.
Would this have any impact on downstream processes?
Thank you.

title: XY rescaling
body:
The RescaleBinnedFiles.R file contains the following condition to detect male samples:
```
# is this a male sample?
  if('chrX' %in% bin_df$chr & mean(bin_df$counts[bin_df$chr == 'chrY'])/mean(bin_df$counts[bin_df$chr == 'chrX']) > 0.5)
```
If I understand correctly, it means that chrY in male samples would have at least 50% of the coverage of chrX. This takes into account the whole chromosomes X and Y. 
Given the size difference between chrX and chrY, have you tried thresholds other than 0.5 ?
How does this function behave regarding pseudo autosomal regions, especially given the previous mappability rescaling step?
Is this condition valid for both input samples and epitope samples? 
Thank you.
